title.narrative: Sustainable Urban Water management/Strategic Sector Cooperation project in Udaipur, India

description.narrative:
Strategic Sector Cooperation in Urban Water Management Between Denmark and India, Phase I
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Urban Water Management is a peer-to-peer cooperation between Aarhus Municipality and Udaipur Municipal. The main objective of the cooperation is to make sustainable and liveable smart cities integrating global sustainable solutions. India is experiencing a rapid urbanization with an expected increase in the urban population at 200 million people in 2030. Rapid urbanization strains resources, the environment, air and quality, if not done sustainably. The sector cooperation will contribute towards the implementation of Government of India’s smart city programme covering 100 smart cities and towards sustainable and livable smart cities integrating global sustainable solutions:
• Model for restoration of Ayad River front • Masterplan for integrated management of the entire water cycle in Udaipur • Mapping of ground water resources and assistance in developing a plan for sustainable extraction. • Analysis and recommendations for improved sewage water treatment with integrated energy production • Knowledge exchange on storm water management • Knowledge exchange and recommendations on management of drinking water systems, including detection of leakages. • Introduction of methods for integrated urban planning with multi-stakeholder approach
